result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob James Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jacob James Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jacob James Johnson was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:44 PM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob James Johnson in court in custody from the Columbia County Jail.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Jacob James Johnson. Cases called: 19 CT 323, 20 CM 488, 21 CM 449, 22 CM 310, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1 in 19 CT 323, Ct. 1 in 20 CM 488 and Ct. 1 in 22 CM 310, Court finds defendant guilty, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 2 in 19 CT 323 dismissed, Ct. 2, 3, and 4 in 22 CM 310 dismissed, 21 CM 449 dismissed, Court sentences defendant to: 19 CT 323, Ct. 1, 60 days jail w/Huber, sentence to commence forthwith, $1,870.00 fine/costs, due in 60 days or payment plan, $65.00 Blood Draw Fee, 26 month D.L. revocation, 26 months IID, AODA and comply, Defendant to submit DNA Sample, 1 day sentence credit, 20 CM 488, Ct. 1, 30 days jail w/Huber, consecutive to 19 CT 323, $443.00 costs, due in 60 days or payment plan, DNA Sample, 1 day sentence credit, 22 CM 310, Ct. 1, 30 days jail, w/Huber, consecutive to 19 CT 323 and 20 CM 488, $443.00 costs, due in 60 days or payment plan, DNA Sample, 26 days sentence credit
